subject: Psychology
title: Flashbulb Memories
description: A fast breakdown of Flashbulb Memories for builders.

hook.text: Everyone remembers where they were on September 11, 2001. Or do they? The memory feels perfect.

buildup.text: Flashbulb memories are vivid, detailed recollections of where you were during a shocking event.

discovery.text: Brown and Kulik proposed that emotional shock creates a special 'now print' mechanism in the brain.

twist.text: Follow-up studies found flashbulb memories are vivid but not accurate. Details shift over time like any memory.

climax.text: The feeling of certainty is the illusion. Flashbulb memories just feel more real ‚Äî they aren't more true.

quiz.question: What is true about flashbulb memories?
options: They feel vivid but are not more accurate than other memories
They only form during positive events
